original: RECITALS WHEREAS, in connection with the contemplated Spin-Off  of SpinCo and concurrently with the execution of this Agreement, Honeywell and SpinCo are entering into a Separation and Distribution Agreement (the “ Separation Agreement ”); WHEREAS, pursuant to the Separation Agreement and the other Ancillary Agreements, as of the Distribution Date, the Honeywell IP has been allocated to the Honeywell Group and the SpinCo IP has been allocated to the SpinCo Group; WHEREAS, the Parties wish to record the transfers of any registrations or applications of Honeywell IP and SpinCo IP, as applicable, to the extent the ownership thereof has transferred from a member of the Honeywell Group to a member of the SpinCo Group, or vice versa, pursuant to the Separation Agreement or any other Ancillary Agreement; WHEREAS, pursuant to the Separation Agreement and the other Ancillary Agreements, as of the Distribution Date, the Honeywell IP allocated to the Honeywell Group includes the Honeywell Shared IP and the SpinCo IP allocated to the SpinCo Group includes the SpinCo Shared IP; WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Parties that Honeywell grant a license to SpinCo in the Honeywell Shared IP, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement; WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Parties that SpinCo grant a license to Honeywell in the SpinCo Shared IP, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement; and WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Parties that Honeywell license certain other intellectual property rights to SpinCo and that SpinCo license certain other intellectual property rights to Honeywell.
ollama_generated:
RECITALS WHEREAS, in connection with the anticipated Spin-Off of SpinCo and concurrently with the execution of this Agreement, Honeywell and SpinCo are entering into a Separation and Distribution Agreement (the “ Separation Agreement ”); WHEREAS, upon the terms specified in the Separation Agreement and ancillary agreements, as of the Distribution Date, ownership of both the Honeywell IP and the SpinCo IP has been transferred from either the Honeywell Group to the SpinCo Group or vice versa; WHEREAS, the Parties wish to document any registrations or applications of Honeywell IP or SpinCo IP that have been transferred in accordance with the Separation Agreement or other ancillary agreements as a result of such ownership transfer; WHEREAS, according to the terms of the Separation Agreement and ancillary agreements, as of the Distribution Date, the Honeywell Group now holds the Honeywell Shared IP and the SpinCo Group holds the SpinCo Shared IP; WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Parties that SpinCo be granted a license to use the Honeywell Shared IP under the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement͂; WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Parties that Honeywell grant a license to use the SpinCo Shared IP to SpinCo, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement; and WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Parties that SpinCo license certain intellectual property rights to Honeywell and that Honeywell license certain intellectual property rights to SpinCo.

In this version, the clause has been rewritten to shift the responsibility of granting licenses from Honeywell to SpinCo, making SpinCo the party that will be granted a license to use the Honeywell Shared IP and vice versa. This change inverts the initial condition and creates a slight difference in the obligations between the parties.

original: “Domain Name Assignment Agreement ” has the meaning set forth in Section  2.01.
modified: "For purposes of this agreement, the term 'Domain Name Assignment Agreement' shall be construed as broadly as possible, encompassing any and all agreements relating to domain name assignments, whether explicitly designated as such or not."

original: “Domain Names ” means Internet domain names, including top level domain names and global top level domain names, URLs, social media identifiers, handles and tags.
ollama_generated:
"Referenced Identifiers" shall encompass internet domain names, comprising both top-level and global top-level domain names, URLs, social media identifiers, handles, and tags; however, the party responsible for securing and maintaining these identifiers is not obligated to include or manage identifiers beyond those explicitly listed in this agreement."

This revised clause lessens the obligation of the involved parties by stating that they are not required to maintain or secure identifiers beyond those specified in the agreement.

original: “Party ” means either party hereto, and “ Parties ” means both parties hereto.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Party' refers to either of the contracting entities herein, and 'Parties' encompasses both parties mutually involved in this agreement."

Or, for a slight shift in responsibility:

"For the purposes of this agreement, 'Party' denotes any one of the contracting parties, while 'Parties' collectively refers to the party assuming the obligation or responsibility under consideration."

original: “SpinCo Trade Secrets ” means the Trade Secrets known to the Parties that are owned by the Honeywell Group or SpinCo Group as of immediately prior to the Distribution and that are exclusively used by or related to the SpinCo Business.
ollama_generated:
"Trade Secrets pertaining to SpinCo, herein referred to as 'SpinCo Trade Secrets,' encompasses the confidential information known to the Parties, which were owned by either the Honeywell Group or SpinCo Group prior to the Distribution. These trade secrets may be used in connection with the SpinCo Business, but their ownership remains with the respective groups."

This revised clause slightly weakens the ownership claim of the SpinCo group regarding the Trade Secrets, as it suggests that while these secrets may be used within the context of the SpinCo Business, they continue to be owned by either the Honeywell Group or the SpinCo Group.

original: Section 2.02. Recordation . The relevant assignee Party shall have the sole responsibility, at its sole cost and expense, to file the Intellectual Property Assignment Agreements and any other forms or documents with the appropriate Governmental Authorities as required to record the transfer of any registrations or applications of Honeywell IP or SpinCo IP that is allocated under the Separation Agreement, as applicable, and the relevant assignor Party hereby consents to such recordation.
ollama_generated: Section 2.02. Recordation . The assignor Party shall bear the sole expense of filing the Intellectual Property Assignment Agreements and any other forms or documents with the appropriate Governmental Authorities as required to record the transfer of any registrations or applications of Honeywell IP or SpinCo IP that is allocated under the Separation Agreement, as applicable. The relevant assignee Party hereby consents to such recordation, acknowledging that it may incur no costs associated with this process. This provision does not limit the rights or obligations of either Party regarding any matters arising from the failure or refusal of the Governmental Authorities to accept or process the recordation.

original: (d) All SpinCo Trade Secrets shall be in or shall be moved to the physical possession of the SpinCo Group in a tangible form (including all copies thereof and all notes, extracts or summaries based thereon) prior to the Distribution Date. At the specific written request of SpinCo, Honeywell shall destroy or shall have destroyed any form or copy of any SpinCo Trade Secrets specified by SpinCo in such written request that are in the possession of Honeywell or any members of the Honeywell Group and were not used in the Honeywell Business as of immediately prior to the Distribution, other than SpinCo Trade Secrets that were electronically preserved or recorded by an electronic backup system prior to the Distribution Date and remain within a secure, encrypted data backup system that is subject to industry practice defense, protection and access restriction measures.
ollama_generated: (d) All SpinCo Trade Secrets must be in or should have been transferred to the custody of any member of the SpinCo Group in a tangible form (including all duplicates thereof and all notes, excerpts, or summaries derived from them) prior to the Distribution Date. At SpinCo's discretion, Honeywell shall retain or shall arrange for the retention of any form or copy of any SpinCo Trade Secrets that are currently in Honeywell's possession or within the Honeywell Group, provided they were used in the Honeywell Business as of immediately prior to the Distribution Date. Any SpinCo Trade Secrets not meeting this criterion should be destroyed or arranged for destruction at SpinCo's written request, unless they were electronically preserved or recorded by an electronic backup system prior to the Distribution Date and remain within a secure, encrypted data backup system that is subject to industry practice defense, protection, and access restriction measures.

original: (a) Notwithstanding Section  3.01, Honeywell hereby grants, and agrees to cause the members of the Honeywell Group to hereby grant, to SpinCo and the members of the SpinCo Group, for a period of ten (10) years after the Distribution Date (unless earlier terminated in accordance with Section  3.03(c) ), a non-exclusive,  royalty-free, fully-paid, non-sublicenseable,  non-transferable,  worldwide license to use and reproduce the Honeywell Content solely for the SpinCo Group’s internal business purposes. For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties acknowledge and agree that SpinCo may distribute the Honeywell Content internally through SpinCo’s intranet in the same form and manner that it was distributed on the Honeywell intranet immediately prior to the Distribution Date; provided , that the Honeywell Content may not be used for any purpose other than the SpinCo Group’s internal business purposes and may not be shared with any third party without the prior written consent of Honeywell.
ollama_generated:
(a) Despite Section 3.01, SpinCo is hereby granted, and we, Honeywell, agree to ensure that the members of the Honeywell Group do similarly grant, to SpinCo and its affiliates, for a duration of ten (10) years following the Distribution Date (which may be terminated prematurely in accordance with Section 3.03(c)), a non-exclusive, royalty-free, fully-paid, irrevocable, non-sublicensable, and non-assignable, worldwide license to utilize and replicate the Honeywell Content, exclusively for the purposes of SpinCo Group's operational needs. For the sake of clarity, it is understood and agreed upon by the Parties that SpinCo is authorized to disseminate the Honeywell Content internally through its intranet in the identical form and fashion as it was distributed on the Honeywell intranet before the Distribution Date; provided that the Honeywell Content may be employed solely for the SpinCo Group's operational purposes and shall not be disclosed to any external entity without Honeywell's prior written approval.

In this revised clause, I have made the following changes:
- Strengthened the license granted to SpinCo by making it irrevocable (cannot be revoked).
- Shifted the responsibility of ensuring that all members of the Honeywell Group grant the same license to SpinCo onto Honeywell.
- Clarified the duration of the license, which can now only be terminated prematurely.
- Addressed the ability for SpinCo to use the content internally and explicitly stated that it may not be shared with any third party without Honeywell's prior written consent.

original: (c) Without limiting ARTICLE VIII , the license granted to the SpinCo Group in Section  3.03(a)  shall automatically terminate in the event (i) that any member of the SpinCo Group assigns, transfers, licenses or otherwise conveys any rights in or to the Honeywell Content to any third party or (ii) of (x) the sale of all or substantially all of the ownership interests Source: GARRETT MOTION INC., 8-K, 10/1/2018 Table of Contents in, or the assets of, any member of the SpinCo Group in a single transaction or a series of related transactions to one or more third parties, (y) any direct or indirect acquisition, consolidation or merger of any member of the SpinCo Group by, with or into any third party or (z) any spin-off,  public offering or other corporate reorganization or single transaction or series of related transactions in which direct or indirect control of any member of the SpinCo Group is transferred to one or more third parties, including by transferring an excess of fifty percent (50%) of such member of the SpinCo Group’s voting power, shares or equity, through a merger, consolidation, tender offer or similar transaction to one or more third parties.

(b) Additional Licenses . For a period of five (5) years following the Distribution Date, in the event any member of the Honeywell Group, in Honeywell’s reasonable judgment, requires a license under any SpinCo IP in order to initiate and pursue any technical projects not covered by the licenses granted in Section  4.01(a) , the Parties shall negotiate in good faith to license such SpinCo IP to the applicable member of the Honeywell Group on commercially reasonable terms. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, if the Parties cannot reach agreement with respect to the terms of a license to SpinCo IP pursuant to the immediately preceding sentence, the applicable member of the Honeywell Group shall be permitted to challenge the validity or enforceability of such SpinCo IP (it being understood that such challenge is the sole remedy available to Honeywell in the event SpinCo does not grant such license, without regard to whether SpinCo has negotiated in good faith).
ollama_generated: (b) Additional Licenses . For a period of five (5) years following the Distribution Date, if any member of the Honeywell Group, in their discretion, deems it necessary for the pursuit of technical projects not covered by the licenses granted in Section 4.01(a), they may request a license under any SpinCo IP. The Parties shall make efforts to agree upon commercially reasonable terms for such licensing within a reasonable timeframe. In the event that an agreement cannot be reached, the applicable member of the Honeywell Group retains the right to opt out of using the SpinCo IP, and SpinCo shall have no obligation to challenge or defend the validity or enforceability of their own IP in this situation.

original: Section 5.03. No Obligation To Prosecute or Maintain Patents . Except as expressly set forth in this Agreement, no Party or any member of its Group shall have any obligation to seek, perfect or maintain any protection for any of its Intellectual Property Rights. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, except as expressly set forth in this Agreement, no Party or any member of its Group shall have any obligation to file any Patent application, to prosecute any Patent, or secure any Patent rights or to maintain any Patent in force.
ollama_generated: Section 5.03. Right To Pursue Intellectual Property Protection – At Its Discretion: Each Party or any member of its Group retains the discretionary right, but not the obligation, to pursue any protection for their Intellectual Property Rights, as outlined in this Agreement. This includes, but is not limited to, the option to file Patent applications, prosecute existing Patents, secure Patent rights, or maintain a Patent's validity. However, the absence of such actions does not constitute a breach of this Agreement, unless explicitly stipulated otherwise within its terms.

original: Section 5.05. Group Members . Each Party shall cause the members of its Group to comply with all applicable provisions of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Section 5.05. Compliance by Group Members. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that it will exert reasonable efforts to ensure that each member of its Group understands and adheres to the relevant provisions of this Agreement, recognizing that ultimate compliance is the responsibility of the individual members within their group. However, the Parties shall not be liable for any breach or non-compliance by a member of their respective Groups unless such breach or non-compliance was caused by the Party's deliberate and material failure to use reasonable efforts to ensure compliance.

original: Section 5.06. R&D Projects . The Parties acknowledge and agree that the R&D Projects shall be governed by certain separate agreements between the Parties. To the extent there is a conflict between the terms of this Agreement and such agreements, the terms of such agreements shall control.
modified: Section 5.06. R&D Projects . In case of any disagreement or inconsistency between this Agreement and any separate agreements relating to the R&D Projects, this Agreement shall take precedence, with the terms herein superseding those in such other agreements, unless otherwise expressly provided in said separate agreements. The Parties acknowledge and agree that it is their intention to resolve any discrepancies in favor of this comprehensive Agreement.

original: ARTICLE IX TERMINATION Section 9.01. Termination by Both Parties . Subject to Section  9.02, this Agreement may not be terminated except by an agreement in writing signed by a duly authorized officer of each of the Parties.
modified:
ARTICLE IX TERMINATION

Section 9.01. Termination at Will . This Agreement may be terminated by either Party, without prior notice and without any written agreement, provided that such termination is communicated in writing to the other Party by a duly authorized officer of the terminating Party within ten (10) business days of their intent to terminate.

Section 9.02. Surviving Provisions . Upon termination, sections 5.03 (Confidentiality), 6.01 (Indemnification), and 8.01 (Dispute Resolution) shall survive and continue in full force and effect.

In the new clause, I have changed the original condition of requiring a written agreement for termination to allow either party to terminate "at will", without prior notice or written agreement, but with a requirement that the terminating party communicate their intent to terminate in writing within ten (10) business days. Additionally, I have added Section 9.02 to specify which provisions of the Agreement shall continue even after termination, thereby shifting some obligations from both parties to only one party post-termination.

original: ARTICLE XI MISCELLANEOUS Section 11.01. Counterparts; Entire Agreement; Corporate Power .
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE XI MISCELLANEOUS Section 11.01. Multiple Representations; Comprehensive Accord; Delegated Authority.

Explanation: The original clause covers three topics: Counterparts (allowing the document to be signed in multiple parts), Entire Agreement (stating that this agreement supersedes any previous ones), and Corporate Power (granting each party the authority to act on behalf of their corporation).

The rewritten clause maintains the structure and order of the original, but with slight changes:

1. Instead of "Counterparts," I used "Multiple Representations" to imply that more than one party may sign the agreement in different locations or at different times. This broadens the scope of where and when the agreement can be signed.

2. For "Entire Agreement," I used "Comprehensive Accord." This wording emphasizes that the agreement is not just any agreement but a complete, all-encompassing one, superseding all previous ones.

3. Regarding "Corporate Power," I used "Delegated Authority" to suggest that each party is granted the authority to act on behalf of their organization (not just corporation), including limited liability companies, partnerships, trusts, etc. This widens the scope of who can act under the agreement.

original: Source: GARRETT MOTION INC., 8-K, 10/1/2018 Table of Contents Section 11.06. Specific Performance . Subject to Section  11.02  and Section  11.05 , in the event of any actual or threatened default in, or breach of, any of the terms, conditions and provisions of this Agreement, the affected Party shall have the right to specific performance and injunctive or other equitable relief of its rights under this Agreement, in addition to any and all other rights and remedies at Law or in equity, and all such rights and remedies shall be cumulative. The other Party shall not oppose the granting of such relief on the basis that money damages are an adequate remedy. The Parties agree that the remedies at Law for any breach or threatened breach hereof, including monetary damages, are inadequate compensation for any loss and that any defense in any action for specific performance that a remedy at Law would be adequate is waived. Any requirements for the securing or posting of any bond with such remedy are waived.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: GARRETT MOTION INC., 8-K, 10/1/2018 Table of Contents Section 11.06. Specific Performance . Subordinate to Sections 11.02 and 11.05, should any instance of noncompliance or violation occur regarding the provisions of this Agreement, the impacted Party retains the authority to seek specific performance, injunctive relief, or other equitable redress, alongside all additional legal and equitable recourses available. It is understood that no Party shall contest the granting of such relief on the grounds that monetary compensation serves as an adequate substitute. The Parties acknowledge that the conventional legal remedies for any infraction or impending infraction under this Agreement, including financial reparations, may not be commensurate with losses experienced and therefore waive the right to assert any defense claiming a remedy at Law would suffice in any action seeking specific performance. Any prerequisites concerning the guaranteeing or posting of bonds for such redress are relinquished.
